items.title: COVID-19 Booster Shots Available at County Event Center; New Times Available for Children’s “Playland” Clinic
items.summary: County health officials are urging all eligible adults to receive a COVID-19 booster shot as soon as possible.

items.title: Board of Supervisors Create County Gun Buyback Program
items.summary: Today, the San Mateo County Board of Supervisors approved a grant of up to $208,000 in Measure K Reserves to establish a San Mateo County Gun Buyback Program.&nbsp;

items.title: Board of Supervisors Adopts 2021 Multijurisdictional Local Hazard Mitigation Plan
items.summary: The San Mateo County Board of Supervisors today adopted the 2021 Multijurisdictional Local Hazard Mitigation Plan, a five-year blueprint for the County and its partners to reduce the impact of natural hazards such as earthquake, fire, flooding, extreme heat and landslide.

items.title: San Mateo County Sheriff No Longer Responding to ICE Inmate Transfer Requests
items.summary: San Mateo County Sheriff Carlos Bolanos announced today that, effective immediately, his office will no longer respond to any requests from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) for notification of an inmate’s release or transfer any inmate to its custody.

items.title: Choose Local San Mateo County App Launched Across San Mateo County
San Mateo County Veterans Commission to Honor Veteran of the Year
items.summary: Two San Mateo County veterans and a nonprofit that helps senior veterans will be honored this week by the San Mateo County Veterans Commission for their notable commitment and significant effort to improve the quality of life for those who served our country.

items.title: San Mateo County Board of Supervisors Begins Public Hearings on District Boundaries
items.summary: The San Mateo County Board of Supervisors on Tuesday will begin a series of public hearings to discuss proposed maps and give residents the opportunity to voice their interests and provide input on the redrawing of supervisorial district maps.

items.title: San Mateo County Youth Commissioners Recognized for Climate Action
items.summary: The Environmental Justice Subcommittee of the San Mateo County Youth Commission was honored Thursday evening with a 2021 Green California Schools Leadership Award for its&nbsp;role&nbsp;in catalyzing a movement in San Mateo County for youth-led&nbsp;climate emergency declarations.&nbsp;&nbsp;

items.title: “Playland” Fun and Games Aims to Take Sting Out of Vaccination Clinic for Children Ages 5 to 11
items.summary: Superheroes and a red carpet are among the sights that will greet children this Saturday at the San Mateo County Event Center to help take the sting out of the County’s first vaccination clinic for those ages 5 to 11.

items.title: Redistricting Commission Sends Draft Maps to Board of Supervisors
items.summary:
Public hearing set for Tuesday, November 9

Oct. 29, 2021

	Redwood City – An advisory commission tasked with studying potential changes to the boundaries of the county’s five supervisorial districts voted Thursday to send two proposed maps to the Board of Supervisors.
